I write and I draw and I'm sure I cry as much as the rest of yall. feel free to use my art in whatever you want but pls let me know if you do so I can get those nice warm feelings inside ;)

tags: please keep in mind i Am Not an expert in this stuff
summary: elements and symbolism in the mighty nein
title: elements and symbolism in the mighty nein
body:
Hey! So I combined all these posts and edited them, so here’s my combined thoughts about (western) elemental symbolism and our favorite group of assholes

Okay, so first off, is Yasha; I really think about air with her. Yes, we have her wings but also you’ve got her trips away. Really I think it’s interesting, how she’s always been a traveller. Living in the Moorlands rather than a city, then her stay with a Circus, and now she’s part of the Nein- an adventuring party. If we assume her Tribe lived in a village (which I think Jester said and Yasha didn’t correct her) and Zuala was her rock, after the death (destruction) of her grounding, she got extra flighty (Lost time, leaving Xhorhas, worshiping the Lord of Storms). Then, she found another person that grounded her- Molly, and the Circus (“She always comes back”). Now, she has another anchor- the Mighty Nein.

There’s also a fun thought with her being an Aasimar, a distinctly celestial being, associated (generally) with the sky, upwards, but a fallen Aasimar, which could be construed as a connection to earth. (Some of her other earth connections: Zuala’s grave, the flower collections).

Then, Jester. The obvious choice would be water, right? Blue, lived on the coast, very likely her Father is a water genasi, her Mother’s the Ruby of the Sea. However, I’m not just here for aesthetics. Her personality really rings fire to me. Her trickery, her passion, her warmth towards most everyone she meets, just how wild she is. (All of this could also be attributed to air, as well). Also, she doesn’t seem to be the type to hold grudges? Maybe I’ve got this pegged wrong, but when she gets mad it generally burns hot and then burns out quick. (Her anger at Caleb during the Cave Fight, and then her attitude afterwards when she realizes he was mind-spelled)

A quick note though, is how well two opposing elements fit her- water, fire. It’s so perfect that the trickster is made of opposites.

Nott, of course, is water. Her drinking, her phobia, and, as we later learn, Nott was basically born from the water- her drowning in the river. But then, we learn about Veth (time for backstory speculation!) Who was born in Felderwin, the agricultural center of the Empire, if I’m recalling accurately. We can make a fair inference that her family was that of farmers, or else worked the land in some way. Veth goes on to become an alchemist, and while that’s not as blatantly related to the earth as farming, it is still connected to the land- knowledge of plants, for one.

So, if we decide Veth = earth and Nott = water, you have some erosion imagery that’s pretty powerful, especially with how Nott believes that “Veth” is slowly slipping away from her (Couldn’t remember Luke’s face), how Nott is becoming more and more goblin-like; it’s a steady erasure, like the tide on the sand.

Caleb! My dirty, dirty trash son. I think y’all know what the deal is here, fire. Now, strap in, because we’re going for another ride on the speculation-about-past-lives train here: Bren? Total, total fire. From what I can decipher from Liams breadcrumbs, Bren was a child prodigy, a little spark of ambition and smarts- and the symbolism of Bren as a spark that becomes a flame that burns itself out as a metaphor for his journey through the Academy is somethin’ else; in fact, if you’ll allow me a bit of extended metaphor: Bren, a spark, lit by the Academy and Trent, shining brightly, killing his parents and burning out, his time in the Asylum as a pile of ashes.

Speaking of, ashes let us segue nicely into Caleb’s connection with earth. How, in particular, he finds comfort in it- literally smearing himself with mud to sever any connections between him and Bren that others may see, how attached he is to Nott, his best friend, his rock. I fully believe that if Caleb cleaned up, shed the earth and stepped fully back into his fire, he’d turn heads- 16 charisma, like moths to a flame. (Yeah, this got a little poetic, this is what happens when you let english nerds rhapsodize about symbolism).

Now, Beau, Beau is difficult because we know so little about her backstory, compared to the others. Really, all we got (from what she’s both said and implied) is that she was rich, or at least upper middle class, had abusive parents, is gay, does crimes. You could make a case for earth- her loyalty to her friends, her stubbornness, how persistent she is in her search for information, patient defense, and her “I…wait,” scene.

Mostly though, I’m going with air. She’s a monk. Her speed, her acrobatics, how averse (in the early episodes at least, hoorah for character growth!) she was to getting attached. I saw someone put it well in a different post I can’t find for the life of me- “I’ll be friends but only ‘cause you want to be friends”. (Again, this contrasts well with her current attitude towards her friends, how steadfast she is in her support of them, +2 for earth). Another point for air is her mentality about relationships, how she’s a one night stand only kind of girl, “no strings attached”.

Caduceus is another kinder egg character, to use a term I’ve just made up. He’s got super obvious connections on the outside, but he’s also got hidden connections that aren’t actually that hard to find. Anyway! Earth! Obviously! He comes from a family of, essentially, gravediggers, he drinks dead people tea, lived in the middle of the literal fucking woods, worships the Wildmother (I know she also lords over the sea as well as the land, but he primarily has a connection to the woods, okay).

Also, I know there are a fair amount of Party Therapist jokes, but for real he does act in a grounding capacity to most of the party. He’s very steady, from his worldview to the literal timbre of his voice. (Gravelly. Gravelly voice.)

Now, Fjord. The thing about my good good green bastard boi, is that he’s the water guy. He grew up in Port Damali, became a sailor, is a warlock of Uk’otoa, a sea serpent demi-god who rules the sea, etc etc. Recently, however, we’ve seen him take (teeny, tiny) steps away from that. His & Caduceus’ conversation made me think about this, and while one conversation does not a parallel make, there is something to be said for another person who’s trauma relates to water (team drowning victims!) seeking comfort in earth. His conversation with Caduceus brings up the possibility of allying himself with Melora. As mentioned above, while she does technically have domain over the sea (the lighthouse), we’ve mostly seen her as she relates to earth.

Last, but not least, Mr Obnoxious One himself, Molly. For him, I see a very strong case for air. He was essentially born from the earth, but that almost- seems like the remnants of Lucien (spec-u-lation-!). Lucien, the cult leader, who was presumably, if not trusted by, relied on, by the other cult members, given Cree’s reaction. Molly waking up and immediately wandering away is his first move.

He joins the Circus, as close to as home as you can get without actually putting down roots- anyone can leave the Circus, it could get disbanded, new acts are being thought up, discarded, changed. They are traveling to new places all the time, putting on acts, masks, whatever faces they need to sell tickets. His friendship with Yasha, aasimar and Stormlord follower.

If we associate Lucien with earth, stability, roots, Molly’s attitude to learning anything about that can be summed up with Fuck No. (There’s also his peacock/bird imagery.)
body_abstract: Hey! So I combined all these posts and edited them, so here’s my combined thoughts about (western) elemental symbolism and our favorite group of assholes

(Her anger at Caleb during the Cave Fight, and then her attitude afterwards when she realizes he was mind-spelled)

A quick note though, is how well two opposing elements fit her- water, fire. It’s so perfect that the trickster is made of opposites.

Nott, of course, is water. Her drinking, her phobia, and, as we later learn, Nott was basically born from the water- her drowning in the river. But then, we learn about Veth (time for backstory speculation!) Who was born in Felderwin, the agricultural center of the Empire, if I’m recalling accurately. We can make a fair inference that her family was that of farmers, or else worked the land in some way. Veth goes on to become an alchemist, and while that’s not as blatantly related to the earth as farming, it is still connected to the land- knowledge of plants, for one.

So, if we decide Veth = earth and Nott = water, you have some erosion imagery that’s pretty powerful, especially with how Nott believes that “Veth” is slowly slipping away from her (Couldn’t remember Luke’s face), how Nott is becoming more and more goblin-like; it’s a steady erasure, like the tide on the sand.

Caleb! My dirty, dirty trash son. I think y’all know what the deal is here, fire. Now, strap in, because we’re going for another ride on the speculation-about-past-lives train here: Bren? Total, total fire. From what I can decipher from Liams breadcrumbs, Bren was a child prodigy, a little spark of ambition and smarts- and the symbolism of Bren as a spark that becomes a flame that burns itself out as a metaphor for his journey through the Academy is somethin’ else; in fact, if you’ll allow me a bit of extended metaphor: Bren, a spark, lit by the Academy and Trent, shining brightly, killing his parents and burning out, his time in the Asylum as a pile of ashes.

Speaking of, ashes let us segue nicely into Caleb’s connection with earth. How, in particular, he finds comfort in it- literally smearing himself with mud to sever any connections between him and Bren that others may see, how attached he is to Nott, his best friend, his rock. I fully believe that if Caleb cleaned up, shed the earth and stepped fully back into his fire, he’d turn heads- 16 charisma, like moths to a flame. (Yeah, this got a little poetic, this is what happens when you let english nerds rhapsodize about symbolism).

Now, Beau, Beau is difficult because we know so little about her backstory, compared to the others. Really, all we got (from what she’s both said and implied) is that she was rich, or at least upper middle class, had abusive parents, is gay, does crimes. You could make a case for earth- her loyalty to her friends, her stubbornness, how persistent she is in her search for information, patient defense, and her “I…wait,” scene.

Mostly though, I’m going with air. She’s a monk. Her speed, her acrobatics, how averse (in the early episodes at least, hoorah for character growth!) she was to getting attached. I saw someone put it well in a different post I can’t find for the life of me- “I’ll be friends but only ‘cause you want to be friends”. (Again, this contrasts well with her current attitude towards her friends, how steadfast she is in her support of them, +2 for earth). Another point for air is her mentality about relationships, how she’s a one night stand only kind of girl, “no strings attached”.

Caduceus is another kinder egg character, to use a term I’ve just made up. He’s got super obvious connections on the outside, but he’s also got hidden connections that aren’t actually that hard to find. Anyway! Earth! Obviously! He comes from a family of, essentially, gravediggers, he drinks dead people tea, lived in the middle of the literal fucking woods, worships the Wildmother (I know she also lords over the sea as well as the land, but he primarily has a connection to the woods, okay).

Also, I know there are a fair amount of Party Therapist jokes, but for real he does act in a grounding capacity to most of the party. He’s very steady, from his worldview to the literal timbre of his voice. (Gravelly. Gravelly voice.)

Now, Fjord. The thing about my good good green bastard boi, is that he’s the water guy. He grew up in Port Damali, became a sailor, is a warlock of Uk’otoa, a sea serpent demi-god who rules the sea, etc etc. Recently, however, we’ve seen him take (teeny, tiny) steps away from that. His & Caduceus’ conversation made me think about this, and while one conversation does not a parallel make, there is something to be said for another person who’s trauma relates to water (team drowning victims!) seeking comfort in earth. His conversation with Caduceus brings up the possibility of allying himself with Melora. As mentioned above, while she does technically have domain over the sea (the lighthouse), we’ve mostly seen her as she relates to earth.

Last, but not least, Mr Obnoxious One himself, Molly. For him, I see a very strong case for air. He was essentially born from the earth, but that almost- seems like the remnants of Lucien (spec-u-lation-!). Lucien, the cult leader, who was presumably, if not trusted by, relied on, by the other cult members, given Cree’s reaction. Molly waking up and immediately wandering away is his first move.

He joins the Circus, as close to as home as you can get without actually putting down roots- anyone can leave the Circus, it could get disbanded, new acts are being thought up, discarded, changed. They are traveling to new places all the time, putting on acts, masks, whatever faces they need to sell tickets. His friendship with Yasha, aasimar and Stormlord follower.

If we associate Lucien with earth, stability, roots, Molly’s attitude to learning anything about that can be summed up with Fuck No. (There’s also his peacock/bird imagery.)
trail.content_abstract: Hey! So I combined all these posts and edited them, so here’s my combined thoughts about (western) elemental symbolism and our favorite group of assholes

blog.name: dr-archeville
blog.title: Doktor Archeville's Laboratory
blog.description:
Hi!  I am a fat 40-something white introvert in NC.  I worked in the NCSU Libraries for 13 years, then was an insurance agent working with Aflac (quack!) for about 9 months, and currently work as a substitute teacher in Roxboro & a repairer/maintainer of sewing machines out of my home.
My preferred pronouns are he/him/his; my preferred nicknames are Doc or Dok, or Science Squid (or Jon).

I am a fan of... things.  So many things.
* Comics (DC Comics, Marvel Comics)
* Tabletop RPGs (Dungeons & Dragons/D&D/DnD, Eclipse Phase, GURPS, Pathfinder, Shadowrun, World of Darkness) (My OCs, my games)
* Video Games (Elder Scrolls series, Fallout series, Minecraft)
* Podcasts (Binging with Babish, Critical Role)
* Webcomics (Order of the Stick, Oglaf, SMBC, Schlock Mercenary, xkcd)
* Geek Culture /  Geek Life /  Misc. Geekery (including memes)

Basically, if it's got cosplay, fantasy, horror (esp. body horror and zombies), science (or SCIENCE!) & sci-fi, steampunk, or superheroes (or supervillains), I'll probably love it.

I also try to keep up with actual science and technology, especially body modification and transhumanism.
I also blog about libraries and library- & librarian-related things (including books), in part because I'd worked in a library for thirteen years, and about education (especially education in NC and education in America) due to my work in academic libraries and as a substitute teacher.  And about language and linguistics, as those fascinate me.
Also about jobs and job hunting, since I've been unemployed or underemployed for an uncomfortably long time, and we could all use a little help there.
I also enjoy cooking (and food), which is a type of science.  Here are some recipes I've collected.

This being the internet, I also reblog posts with cute animals.  I'm especially fond of bats.  And squid, cuttlefish, and other cephalopods. While I'm listing animals, I may as well provide a link to my cat posts.  It is the internet, so there are a lot of them.

I'm a big fan of/believer in people being themselves, and of consenting adults being able to do whatever they want however they want with whoever they want, no matter what others think.  (I.e., body positivity, sex positivity).  I try to keep this blog SFW -- the only porn I'll be posting here are food porn and technology porn -- but I do sometimes talk about sex (esp. sex education) and burlesque (there are some great burly troupes in the Triangle & Triad area).

I struggle with mild depression and anxiety issues, so sometimes my blog may get a bit maudlin.  But I also try to give advice on dealing with those, too.
-----------------------
Things I've Liked (Note: May contain some NSFW posts)
My Tumblr Crushes
My personal blargings
About Me / It Me
Getting To Know Me
My TMI Tuesday blargings
My Feels

Conventions!
* Animazement
* ConCarolinas
* ConTemporal
* Cosplay America
* Dragon*Con / Dragon Con

My Face
My Facebook
Art-related blargings
Music-related blargings
Most Fridays nights I’m at the Retro Film shows at the the Carolina Theatre in Durham.  Come join me!

summary: the talisman bookstore and apothecary - theres-no-comma (littleboxes) - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
title: the talisman bookstore and apothecary - theres-no-comma (littleboxes) - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
when trent ikithon offers bren a chance to enter into advanced classes, bren wants to, almost says yes- but his instincts give him pause.

when bren aldric ermendrud is fifteen, he does not become the pupil of one trent ikithon, and his life is better off for it.
